TITLE: How Marina Khidekel, the Hugimals Founder, Spends Her Sundays
SUMMARY: Marina Khidekel founded Hugimals World as an answer to her own anxiety. She spends her Sundays watching “Hacks,” hanging out with other female founders and dropping in at a factory.

TITLE: Bills and Lions Give NFL Fans in Canada Reason to Cheer
SUMMARY: With the Buffalo Bills and Detroit Lions both Super Bowl contenders, fans north of the border are nervously hopeful a title drought could end.

TITLE: Celebrity Moguls
SUMMARY: We cover the rise of entrepreneurship in Hollywood.

TITLE: After DeepSeek, Venture Capital Investors Face Questions About Their A.I. Bets
SUMMARY: Venture capitalists plowed money into A.I. start-ups like OpenAI and Anthropic. But the rise of the Chinese A.I. start-up DeepSeek has called that funding frenzy into question.

TITLE: A Youthful Africa Steps Up
SUMMARY: Forecasts suggest that by 2100, a majority of the world’s babies will be African, leading to predictions of an African century.

TITLE: As Big Retailers Pull Back on D.E.I, What Happens to Emerging Black Sellers?
SUMMARY: Black-owned brands got a foot in the door through accelerator programs at companies like Target and Amazon. Now they worry it might be closing.

TITLE: Muere el Aga Khan IV, acaudalado líder de los musulmanes ismailíes
SUMMARY: A los 20 años, el príncipe Karim al Hussaini heredó las riendas de un linaje musulmán chií y utilizó su emprendedurismo para convertirse en uno de los gobernantes herederos más ricos del mundo.

TITLE: The Aga Khan IV, Wealthy Leader of the Ismaili Muslims, Dies at 88
SUMMARY: At the age of 20, Prince Karim Al-Hussaini inherited the reins of a Shia Muslim lineage and used his entrepreneurship to become one of the world’s richest hereditary rulers.

TITLE: As Big Retailers Pull Back on D.E.I., What Happens to Emerging Black Sellers?
SUMMARY: Black-owned brands got a foot in the door through accelerator programs at big retailers like Target and Amazon. Now they worry the door might be closing.

TITLE: How Emily Sundberg’s ‘Feed Me’ Newsletter Made Her Into a Rising Substack Star
SUMMARY: Emily Sundberg’s business newsletter, Feed Me, has made her a rising Substack star.

TITLE: C. Richard Kramlich, Early Investor in Silicon Valley, Dies at 89
SUMMARY: He was among the first backers of Apple Computer and 3Com, earning windfalls, but it was his humaneness that distinguished him from other venture capitalists.

TITLE: The Actor Fred Savage’s New Role Is as a Watch Entrepreneur
SUMMARY: The actor, who spent his childhood in “The Wonder Years,” has established a watch assessment service.

TITLE: A New York Restaurant, a Texas Farm and Their Plant-Based Brawl
SUMMARY: They shared the same name, Dirt Candy, and a devotion to healthy food. But a trademark dispute turned into an urban-rural standoff.

TITLE: Woman Pleads Guilty in Covid Tax Credit Scheme That Netted $33 Million
SUMMARY: A Nevada business owner prepared and filed false tax returns to fraudulently obtain Covid relief money for her businesses and others, prosecutors said.

TITLE: They’ve Been Waiting Years to Go Public. They’re Still Waiting.
SUMMARY: Some tech companies are delaying or pulling their listing plans as the Trump administration’s tariff announcements and other changes cause market volatility and uncertainty.

TITLE: A.I. Is Changing How Silicon Valley Builds Start-Ups
SUMMARY: Tech start-ups typically raised huge sums to hire armies of workers and grow fast. Now artificial intelligence tools are making workers more productive and spurring tales of “tiny team” success.

TITLE: Is Xi’s Sudden Embrace of Business for Real? China Is Left Guessing.
SUMMARY: The uncertain reaction to Xi Jinping’s display of warmth made sense: Executives are eager for a reset after years in the cold but ever wary of meddling.

TITLE: 4 Black Women Who Mixed Fine Dining, Fashion and Art in New York
SUMMARY: The dining rooms created by these restaurateurs weren’t just eye-catching; they were stages for their owners’ personal stories.

TITLE: Where Have All the ‘Third Places’ Gone?
SUMMARY: The term, coined by a sociologist in the 1980s, refers to informal public spaces where people can linger — and some say they’re disappearing.

TITLE: Elon Musk Is the World’s Richest Man. Why Is He Sleeping on an Office Floor?
SUMMARY: For today’s entrepreneurs, work isn’t merely a way to get things done; it’s also a “superpower” that confers the right to impose their vision on the world.

TITLE: The Return of Digg, a Star of Web 2.0
SUMMARY: Two decades after creating Digg, a community-focused social message board, Kevin Rose is reviving the site and teaming up with a founder of Reddit.

TITLE: Trish Costello is Harnessing the Financial Power of Women
SUMMARY: Trish Costello is the founder and C.E.O. of Portfolia, a women-focused investment platform that is fueling health care innovations aimed at improving women’s lives.

SUMMARY: The media entrepreneur Jessica Lessin chats with DealBook about the news landscape and her latest media bet.

TITLE: Eric Schmidt Joins Relativity Space as C.E.O.
SUMMARY: The former Google chief executive is taking a controlling interest in Relativity Space, which aims to build low-cost, reusable rockets to compete against Elon Musk’s SpaceX and to reach Mars.

TITLE: Young Professionals Are Increasingly Turning to Boring Small-Business Niches
SUMMARY: Younger would-be chief executives are increasingly seeking profits — and freedom from the 9-to-5 — by pivoting from corporate jobs into often unglamorous small-business niches.

SUMMARY: He became an entrepreneur during a solid career with the Milwaukee Bucks. He later bought hundreds of fast-food outlets, a Coca-Cola bottling business and Ebony and Jet magazines.

SUMMARY: When Lucy’s, a homey New York tavern, closed down and underwent a renovation, some longtime patrons feared the worst.

SUMMARY: In “Abundance,” Ezra Klein and Derek Thompson prod fellow liberals to think beyond their despair over Trump’s return to power.

SUMMARY: Government bodies nationwide have been eager to show they are using DeepSeek’s A.I. technology since the company’s founder met with Xi Jinping, China’s leader.

TITLE: How Small Restaurants Are Dealing With Record Egg Prices
SUMMARY: Mom-and-pop businesses are trying to adapt to the soaring cost of eggs. The owners of four egg-centric restaurants across the country show how they are coping with this threat to their livelihoods.

SUMMARY: Mei Kawajiri hand-paints and sculpts custom designs for a clientele that includes Heidi Klum and Bad Bunny.

SUMMARY: I didn’t know a topcoat from a base coat. But writing about an unfamiliar subject made me a better reporter.

SUMMARY: President Trump vowed to aid entrepreneurs by reducing taxes and slicing red tape. But some owners say other policies have put them at a disadvantage.

SUMMARY: The government’s promise to reshore the production of simple items like mine looks, from where I sit, like something of a fever dream.

TITLE: A New Book About Baking Bread Is Only Sort of About Bread
SUMMARY: “Existential Bread,” a book by the poet and amateur baker Jim Franks, is only sort of about bread.

TITLE: America Is Learning the Wrong Lesson from Elon Musk’s Success
SUMMARY: Intimidation doesn’t elevate performance; it undermines people.

TITLE: Her Business Was Thriving. Then Came the Tariffs.
SUMMARY: An interview with Beth Benike, who fears for the survival of her small business under Trump’s tariffs.

SUMMARY: Eric Slesinger made a career shift from the spy agency to venture capital, championing military start-ups as Europe beefed up its defenses amid an uncertain relationship with the United States.

SUMMARY: Intimidation doesn’t elevate performance; it undermines people.
